com.adobe.creativesdk.behance

Class AdobeUXBehanceWorkflow

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.adobe.creativesdk.behance.AdobeUXBehanceWorkflow

  • public class AdobeUXBehanceWorkflow
extends java.lang.Object
    AdobeUXBehanceWorkflow has methods to publish Behance Project.

    • Method Detail

      • setFileProviderAuthority

        public static void setFileProviderAuthority(java.lang.String fileProviderAuthority,
                                            android.content.Context context)
        Sets the file-provider authority for Behance's Camera based workflows. Refer : https://developer.android.com/training/camera/photobasics.html
        Parameters:
        fileProviderAuthority - the fileProvider authority name declared in the manifest
        context - the Context from which the Behance workflow is being launched.

      • customizePublishNotifications

                                                 android.content.Context context)
        Gives an option to customize icon and title of Publish-Project apis notification icons.
        Parameters:
        options - the AdobeBehanceCustomizationOptions object containing the customization options of Behance publish notifications.
        context - the Context from which the Behance workflow is being launched.

      • launchAddProject

        public static void launchAddProject(java.lang.Class<? extends android.app.Activity> notificationHandlerActivity,
                                    android.content.Context context)
                             throws com.behance.sdk.exception.BehanceSDKUserNotAuthenticatedException,
                                    com.behance.sdk.exception.BehanceSDKUserNotEntitledException,
                                    BehanceSDKSecurityException
        Launches the workflow to create and add Behance Project. On completion of the workflow the notificationHandlerActivity receives the status as Intent Data.
        Parameters:
        notificationHandlerActivity - the class of the activity which will receive notification on completion of publication. This activity will be invoked when the user clicks on the project publish notification if the project publish is successful.
        context - the Context from which the Behance workflow is being launched.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if argument Context is null.
        com.behance.sdk.exception.BehanceSDKUserNotAuthenticatedException - if User is not authenticated.
        com.behance.sdk.exception.BehanceSDKUserNotEntitledException - if User is not entitled to use this method.
        BehanceSDKSecurityException - if a security manager check fails.

                                    BehanceSDKSecurityException

        Parameters:

        context - the Context from which the Behance workflow is being launched.

      • launchPublishProject

        public static void launchPublishProject(AdobeBehanceSDKPublishProjectOptions options,
                                        android.content.Context context)
                                 throws AdobeBehancePublishInvalidImageException,
                                        com.behance.sdk.exception.BehanceSDKInvalidArgumentException,
                                        com.behance.sdk.exception.BehanceSDKUserNotAuthenticatedException,
                                        com.behance.sdk.exception.BehanceSDKUserNotEntitledException
        Launches the workflow to publish a list of images as Behance project.
        Parameters:
        options - the object containing information regarding the Behance workflow
        context - the Context from which the Behance workflow is being launched.
        Throws:
        AdobeBehancePublishInvalidImageException - if the images are not matching the requirements of the publish project :
        • Allowed file types : jpg, jpeg, png, gif
        • Size : maximum 8MB, maximum 32 mega pixel limit (32,000,000px)
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if argument AdobeBehanceSDKPublishProjectOptions object is null or argument Context is null.
        com.behance.sdk.exception.BehanceSDKUserNotAuthenticatedException - if User is not authenticated.
        com.behance.sdk.exception.BehanceSDKUserNotEntitledException - if User is not entitled to use this method.
        com.behance.sdk.exception.BehanceSDKInvalidArgumentException - if the arguments are invalid.Refer to AdobeBehanceSDKPublishProjectOptions for argument validity.

      • cancelActivePublishProject

        public static void cancelActivePublishProject(java.lang.String publishRequestId,
                                              android.content.Context context)
        Cancels the Project that is being published.
        Parameters:
        publishRequestId - the Unique ID of the publish request. Available in progress update events.
        context - the Context from which the Behance workflow is being launched.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if argument publishRequestId is empty or null or if argument Context is null.

      • displayPublishProjectSuccessView

        public static void displayPublishProjectSuccessView(com.behance.sdk.dto.BehanceSDKPublishProjectStatusDTO projectStatusDTO,
                                                    android.content.Context context)
        Displays a publish successful screen, where the user can see the published Project with an option to view it on Behance.

        Results view will be displayed only if the progress state is PUBLISH_COMPLETE.

        Parameters:
        projectStatusDTO - BehanceSDKPublishProjectStatusDTO object that is available with progress updates.
        context - the Context from which the Behance workflow is being launched.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if argument BehanceSDKPublishProjectStatusDTO object is null or argument Context is null.

      • validateImageForProject

        public static com.behance.sdk.util.BehanceSDKPublishImageValidationResult validateImageForProject(java.io.File imageFile,
                                                                                                  android.content.Context context)
        Checks if Image File matches requirements for uploading to a Project on Behance.

        Requirements:

        • Allowed File Formats: JPG, JPEG, PNG, and GIF
        • File size should be less than or equal to 8 MB.
        Parameters:
        imageFile - File object which needs to be validated
        context - the Context from which the Behance workflow is being launched.
        Returns:
        BehanceSDKPublishImageValidationResult object containing validation result
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if argument File is null.
